intro: Thesium retamoides, commonly known as the golden thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Thesium retamoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
